page.title: 05 RESIDENTS PROBLEMS
page.content: Manchester is responsible for the maintenance of the houses and for choosing the occupants. Tameside shares responsibility for the lawns. The new residents did not want to leave their friends and jobs. The distance from Manchester seemed immense. 90% were said to be unhappy. A lack of facilities led to unrest. It is an expensive bus ride to Hyde to do the shopping.Many of the complaints are about the coldness of the houses and the condensation. During 1984 and 1985 a new central heating system has been put in. Also flat roofs have been replaced by Apex roofs. There is a forum which meets once a month to solve their problems. There is 30% unemployment amongst adults and 60% amongst juveniles.
